revised_title: Toxic Properties of Saliva in Certain 'Non-poisonous' Colubrines
tldr: The authors investigate the toxic properties of saliva in non-poisonous colubrines and find that the parotid secretion of some 'harmless' colubrines is toxic when injected subcutaneously. They also observe a graduated variability in toxicity among different species and suggest that this may be related to the evolution of venomous snakes.
